name: inflectionally

in a way that involves inflection (= a change in or addition to the form of a word that shows a change in the way it is used): This language has relatively few inflectionally marked forms. Children soon learn to produce inflectionally obvious word forms.
More examplesFewer examplesIn Arabic, finite verbs are marked inflectionally for person, number, and gender.Latin and Greek are both inflectionally rich languages.We think that Old English was inflectionally poorer than modern German.
